channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump has a deal for Netanyahu when they meet Tuesday. Will he take it?

item.title: Who will call it the Gulf of America? A look at this and other naming disputes
item.description: Google says it will rename the Gulf of Mexico on its U.S. maps, and Mexico is pushing back. This wouldn't be the first body of water to have different...

item.title: How Trump's tariffs could impact home construction prices

item.title: Santorini on alert as tremors rattle Greek island
item.description: Authorities advise against gatherings in enclosed spaces following a flurry of seismic activity nearby.

item.description: Authorities advise against gatherings in enclosed spaces following a flurry of seismic activity nearby.

item.title: USAID to be merged into State Department, 3 U.S. officials say
item.description: USAID will remain a humanitarian aid entity, but its funding and workforce will be significantly reduced, officials said.

item.description: President Donald Trump’s threat of tariffs on goods from Mexico, Canada and China is aimed at stopping the flow of fentanyl into the U.S.

item.title: Car bomb blast in northern Syria kills at least 20
item.description: The car exploded beside a lorry carrying mostly female agricultural workers outside Manbij.

item.title: Watch: BBC reports from site of Queensland flooding
item.description: BBC Australia reporter Simon Atkinson visits Townsville, which was hit by severe rainfall over the weekend.

item.description: US tariffs on Mexico to be put on hold for month

item.title: National Science Foundation says it will unfreeze grant money after court order
item.description: While NSF is still reviewing how its grants comply with Trump executive orders, it says it will continue to paying existing grants

item.title: Trump threatens to cut funding for South Africa over land policy
item.description: South Africa last month passed a law allowing the seizure of land under certain circumstances.
